TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ApplicationIDAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies the application ID (as a GUID) for this assembly. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ApplicationIDAttribute takes a GUID in its constructor. When registration occurs, the components in the assembly are installed in an application with the given ID.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of the ApplicationIDAttribute type.
[!code-cs[EnterpriseServices.ApplicationIDAttribute#0](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.enterpriseservi_14_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices.ApplicationIDAttribute#0](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.enterpriseservi_14_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string guid) cil managed

Docs.param: The GUID associated with the COM+ application.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class specifying the GUID representing the application ID for the COM+ application.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a new <xref:System.EnterpriseServices.ApplicationIDAttribute>.
[!code-cs[EnterpriseServices.ApplicationIDAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.enterpriseservi_17_1.cs)] [!code-vb[EnterpriseServices.ApplicationIDAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.enterpriseservi_17_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the GUID of the COM+ application.
Docs.value: The GUID representing the COM+ application.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Value is set by the constructor using the GUID passed in as a parameter.
